title: Some kind of search popup right above the taskbar when typing
content: Whenever using Firefox, I keep getting a pop up box on the left side of the bottom of the browser which seems to search the webpage for whatever is in the box. This happens if the cursor is not exactly in a specific search box or designated area on the screen. I can reproduce the problem by clicking on the page (just the page, not a box or input area) then typing. It may be a function, but has become so overwhelmingly annoying that I find it necessary to find a way to deactivate it. If I click something else like another window and don't click the mouse exactly on a specific search box or input area when I go back to the page, it inputs the text I am typing down in this box. I don't like this, I don't want this. Please help me rid the browser of this menace. I put an image of the problem below and circled the offensive box. Thanks for any help given. I did try to search for this issue to see if there was already a solution but could not find one, hence posting this question. I just found out this is the same box that pops up when you click the menu bar button "edit" followed by "find in page". Don't know why in the world this thing is popping up by itself when it is neither needed or desired.

title: Firefox not showing updated information on Facebook pages, but Chrome does!
content:
I manage a corporate page on Facebook. We have 14 pages in total. When I publish a post to our corporate FB page, it automatically posts to the other 13 pages.

When I posted today, Firefox did not show the post in 11 of the 14 pages. I figured it was a problem with out aggregator just not posting to all the pages, but that was not the case. When I used Chrome to look at the pages, the new post was there on every page. When I looked at the pages again using Firefox, the post appeared on only 2 pages.

I've deleted the Firefox cookies, the cache, the history and all downloaded content. I've shutdown and restarted Firefox. But when I go back to my FB pages, the most recent post is not there. But it is there when I go to the exact same URL in Chrome.

What the heck is going on here? Firefox says I'm using the latest available version 95.0.2 (64 bit).
creator: jyunte

title: All my history of bookmarks is being wiped out!
content:
Hello.

I have used firefox for years, and signed in with sync and it automatically synced my bookmarks all the time.

I got a new desktop machine recently & was just trying to setup the firefox on it. It was new and empty of bookmarks. So I signed into my firefox account, then in the bookmark manager, there was an option that appeared to say: 'restore bookmarks..' etc. I did this, but nothing got 'restored' to the new browser.

Then.. on all my other machines, one by one, when I login to them, it is ERASING my bookmarks and leaving nothing !! Arghhhh!!!! I don't know how to deal with it.

title: HTML Canvas measure text width difference
content:
HTML Canvas measure text width value is different from other browsers for Courier New font family.

Please find the width value comparison of the browsers. Google Chrome width: 19.203125 Firefox width: 20 Internet Explorer: 19 Edge: 19.203125

Sample Code: <canvas id="myCanvas" width="300" height="150" style="border:1px solid #d3d3d3;"></canvas> <script> var c = document.getElementById("myCanvas"); var ctx = c.getContext("2d"); ctx.font = "8px courier new"; var txt = "Code" ctx.fillText("width:" + ctx.measureText(txt).width, 10, 50); ctx.fillText(txt, 10, 100); </script>

title: How do you lock the font size in PowerPoint?
content: To prevent PowerPoint from resizing text, you can deactivate the text AutoFit feature by changing the PowerPoint Proofing options. Click the “File” tab on the PowerPoint menu ribbon. Click “Options” in the Help section. Click “Proofing” in the PowerPoint Options dialog box, and then click “AutoCorrect Options.” Fonts Bee
creator: emmabenjamin887

title: How do you change the text editor font?
content: Change the default font Select gedit ▸ Preferences ▸ Font & Colors. Uncheck the box next to the phrase, “Use the system fixed-width font.” Click on the current font name. … After you have chosen a new font, use the slider under the list of fonts to set the default font size. Click Select, and then click Close. Ezzee Fonts
